item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]1: Don’t derail threads to ask stupid questions.
2: Rep doesn’t matter.
3: It was locked because I abused the system.

[quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=498824.msg3647757#msg3647757 date=1309509071]
I think there should be a requirement that people have a basic understand of Java, and common sense before being able to join.
[/quote]I’ll just be packing my things… :’([/quote]

Nah, you’re more than competent enough to be here. It’s sad to say this, but the other students in my Java programming class are at the level of the sub-average MoparScaper.

item.title: [pi] this is a mess but ..< i cant see where i missed a bracket
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I Vain I:

^ Oh you.

oshit, I didn’t even see your post ^_^. I just saw how long the OP’s block of code was and skipped to the bottom, lol.

I think there should be a requirement that people have a basic understand of Java, and common sense before being able to join. But, maybe I’m being pretentious.

And technically, it can be improved even more by using enums.

[code=Java]
private static enum Skill {
ATTACK(0, “Attack”),
DEFENCE(1, “Defence”),
STRENGTH(2, “Strength”),
HIT_POINTS(3, “Hitpoints”),
RANGED(4, “Ranged”),
PRAYER(5, “Prayer”),
MAGIC(6, “Magic”),
COOKING(7, “Cooking”),
WOODCUTTING(8, “Woodcutting”),
FLETCHING(9, “Fletching”),
FISHING(10, “Fishing”),
FIREMAKING(11, “Firemaking”),
CRAFTING(12, “Crafting”),
SMITHING(13, “Smithing”),
MINING(14, “Mining”),
HERBLORE(15, “Herblore”),
AGILITY(16, “Agility”),
THIEVING(17, “Thieving”),
SLAYER(18, “Slayer”),
FARMING(19, “Farming”),
RUNECRAFTING(20, “Runecrafting”);

private final int id;
private final String name;

private Skill(final int id, final String name) throws IllegalArgumentException {
    if (name == null) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("name cannot be null");
    }
    this.id = id;
    this.name = name;
}

public int getId() {
    return id;
}

public String getName() {
    return name;
}

}

private static final String ACHIEVEMENT_STRING = “%s reached level %d in %s!”;

public void announceAchievement(final Skill skill) throws IllegalArgumentException {
if (skill == null) {
throw new IllegalArgumentException(“skill cannot be null”);
}
for (final Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
if (p != null) {
final Client c = (Client) p;
c.sendMessage(String.format(ACHIEVEMENT_STRING, c.getName(), 99, skill.getName()));
}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] this is a mess but ..< i cant see where i missed a bracket
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Yeah, the code can be reduced to

private static final String[] SKILL_NAMES = {
    "Attack", "Defence", "Strength", "Hitpoints", "Ranged", "Prayer", "Magic", "Cooking", "Woodcutting", "Fletching", "Fishing",
    "Firemaking", "Crafting", "Smithing", "Mining", "Herblore", "Agility", "Thieving", "Slayer", "Farming", "Runecrafting"
};

private static final String ACHIEVEMENT_STRING = "%s reached level %d in %s!";

public void announceAchievement(final Skill skill) throws IllegalArgumentException {
    if (skill == null) {
        throw new IllegalArgumentException("skill cannot be null");
    }
    for (final Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
        if (p != null) {
            final Client c = (Client) p;
            c.sendMessage(String.format(ACHIEVEMENT_STRING, c.getName(), 99, SKILL_NAMES[skill.getId()]));
        }
    }
}

Although, I’m not sure if there’s a performance increase in choosing String.format() instead of concatenation in this case.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote]public void nintynineagil(){

for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
} if (c.playerLevel[c.playerAgility] == 99){
c2.sendMessage(""+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +" just got 99 Agility! ");
}
}
}
}[/quote]also, why so much code??

[code=Java]public String getSkillName(int index) {
String[] skills = { “Attack”, “Defence”, “Strength”, “Hitpoints”, Ranged", “Prayer”, “Magic”, “Cooking”, “Woodcutting”, “Fletching”, “Fishing”, “Firemaking”, “Crafting”, “Smithing”, “Mining”, “Herblore”, “Agility”, “Thieving”, “Slayer”, “Farming”, “Runecrafting” };
return skills[index];
}

public void messageOfAchievement(int skillId) {
for (Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
if (p != null) {
Client all = (Client) p;
all.sendMessage(p.properName + " has just achieved 99 " + getSkillName(skillId) + “!”);
} else {
break;
}
}
}[/code][/quote]

Wouldn’t Ranged" be "Ranged"?
